itemDescription: Architect Brady Mallalieu Architects and president of RIBA 2011 - 2013

wikipedia_page.main: Angela Brady OBE  is an Irish-born Irish/British architect and has lived in London for over 25 years. In 2011 she was elected president of the UK's Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA) for a two-year term. She is a past chairperson of the Royal Institute of the Architects of Ireland (RIAI) London Forum.

response: * Angela Brady (born c. 1957), elected president of the UK's Royal Institute of British Architects in 2011

link_mentions.page: List of Dublin Institute of Technology people
response: * Angela Brady, Past President of Royal Institution of British Architects

link_mentions.page: Open Air Theatre, Barra Hall Park
response: The original Open Air Theatre in Barra Hall Park, Hayes was built in 1951 as a community venue for music, theatre and dance. Over time, the structure fell into disrepair, and the local community raised funds for its reconstruction. The 2005 steel-rebuild was designed by architects Angela Brady (now president of the Royal Institute of British Architects) and Robin Mallalieu, whose aim for a theatre which would have sculptural and visual interest even when not in use produced a theatre with an abstract, enigmatic quality.
